Rationale Annotation Instructions

Please read the query carefully and write 3 concise rationales (1–2 sentences each) describing the specific evidence or phrases a passage should contain to support a correct answer. Use clinical, evidence-focused wording and avoid patient identifiers (PHI).

  • Be concise (8–30 words each).
  • Use clinical terms (e.g., "elevated D-dimer", "focal consolidation").
  • If relevant, include lab, imaging, symptom, or risk-factor cues.
  • If you cannot produce 3 rationales, explain why in Rationale 3.
